channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Confused by the U.S. economy? You're not alone
item.description: How are changing tariffs, the AI boom, immigration policies and uncertainty in employment and the stock market impacting the economy? Zanny Minton Bed...

item.title: Iceland reports the presence of mosquitoes for the first time, as climate warms
item.description: The discovery of three Culiseta annulata mosquitoes was confirmed this week by the Natural Science Institute of Iceland, which said the mosquitoes lik...

item.title: VP Vance tries to progress Gaza ceasefire. And, White House demolition draws critics
item.description: Vice President JD Vance is in Israel to address challenges in the Gaza ceasefire. And, the demolition of the East Wing of the White House has drawn cr...

item.title: Mental exercise can reverse a brain change linked to aging, study finds
item.description: Scientists have found the first compelling evidence that cognitive training can boost levels of a brain chemical that typically declines as people age...

item.title: Greetings from an Indian Railways coach, with spectacular views from Mumbai to Goa
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

item.title: University of Virginia strikes deal to pause Trump administration investigations
item.description: The U.S. Justice Department has announced an agreement with the University of Virginia to pause civil rights investigations.

item.title: US forces kill two in strike on alleged drug boat in the Pacific
item.description: This is the eighth US strike on alleged drug trafficking vessels near Latin America, the first on the Pacific side.

item.title: White House plans to demolish entire East Wing as ballroom cost hits $300 million
item.description: The Trump administration is planning to demolish the entirety of the White House's East Wing by this weekend, two senior administration officials said...

item.title: U.S. debt tops $38 trillion for first time, worsened by government shutdown
item.description: The national debt is rising faster than ever and threatens to undermine confidence in the economy, experts warn.

item.title: No camera covered Louvre wall where jewel thieves broke in, director says
item.description: Laurence des Cars said there was only one camera pointing on the gallery which was robbed.

item.title: Furloughed federal workers turn to food bank during government shutdown
item.description: The ongoing government shutdown is now the second-longest in U.S. history, and furloughed federal workers are feeling the real-world impacts. CBS News...

item.title: With Supreme Court ruling still pending, judge extends block on Guard in Chicago indefinitely
Trump says 'existing structure' of White House East Wing to be torn down
item.description: US President Donald Trump previously said that his ballroom addition would not "interfere with the current building".

item.title: UN's top court says Israel obliged to allow UN aid into Gaza
item.description: The court also says Israel has not substantiated its allegations against the UN agency for Palestinian refugees.

item.title: Trump says Putin talks 'don't go anywhere' as he imposes new sanctions
item.description: The US has announced new sanctions on Rosneft and Lukoil, Russia's two largest oil companies over continued fighting in Ukraine.
